head.supplied: 18/8/90 ¶ ¶ I was under the impression, dear Mr Gill, that I had proposed you for the fellowship of the LS., ¶ as I have done for your predecessor, ¶ but amidst multitudinous engagements I must hav...

div.p: RB MSS M33, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

MS is accompanied by an envelope: 'On Her Majesty's Service. Walter Gill Esq | Conservator of Forests &c | Adelaide' and 'Government Botanist, | Melbourne, 18/8 1890'. The front bears the frank stamp of the 'CHIEF SECRETARY VICTORIA' and the postal stamp 'MELBOURNE | AU 18 | 90'. There is an annotation, probably by Gill: 'Re Linnean Society'. The back is stamped 'G.P.O. ADELAIDE S.A. | AU 20 | 90'. 18/8/90

I was under the impression, dear Mr Gill, that I had proposed you for the fellowship of the LS.,
Linnean Society, London. as I have done for your predecessor,
J. Ednie Brown; see M to the Linnean Society of London, January 1879 (in this edition as 79-01-00c). but amidst multitudinous engagements I must have stopped short at the intention. A few £ entrance fee are payable, after election, and then a few £ annually, for which then you get the superb publications of each year gratis. If you like to join, I will arrange all that is needful for an early election into this great Society.
It would appear that Gill asked to be nominated; see M to the Linnean Society, London, September 1890 (in this edition as 90-09-00).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: As this is a moist season, I trust good collections of bot specimens will be forthcoming from the interior under such favorable circumstances. I like to advance the knowledge of Austr. native plants still a little further, before I pass away from my earthly career.
